title: Preseason Healthbar Update v3
body:
How do you do, fellow kids? We’re back with another iteration on the healthbar update based on feedback. Let’s review what we’re trying to achieve here:

**Feels**
- Familiar, but better (no relearning, no change to things like last hitting)
- Game to game differences, not moment to moment
- Interacting with objectives is more satisfying
- Interacting with defensive windows is more satisfying (heals, shreds, etc)
- Bodying fools feels better than ever.

**Gameplay**
- Easier to track the flow of a fight.
- More intuitive play/counterplay around defensive windows.
- More intuitive play/counterplay around unique mechanics (extra life, unstoppable, etc).
- Huge clarity gains when spectating and watching streams.

**V3 Changelist**
- Ammo resources like Jhin, Corki, Annie have the same treatment as Live.
- Lots of color tweaks and some sizing tweaks.
- Lots of animation tweaks.
- Tower burst, shake, and death animations are in.
- Option to turn off shake animation coming this week.
- Baron’s healthbar now stays in place rather than bouncing all over.
- Resurrecting state improvements.

**Future Stuff**
- Healing over time
- Damage over time
- Color code objective takes
- Kill streaking
- Stealth state

**Lookee Lookee**
Here’s a spiffy video which shows the changes in a real game setting. Note, there’s a few spectator bugs here such as dragon health is grey, etc. Try to ignore those <.<
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EmASrtzJRN4&feature=youtu.be

As always, we're still looking for feedback as you guys dive into the changes. Thanks!

it triggers me that enemy's level bar isn't on the right side anymore
On Live only Self is on the left. Both Allies and Enemies are on the right which is why we feel like the new standardization isn't a big deal - color pulls most of the weight here for identification.

Out of curiosity then, why did you pick left as the default side? Since the majority of the health bars we have been looking have had level on the right, it may be less jarring to change the self level to be on the right too, if standardization is the priority. I also agree that color is the most important for identification, but looking for the level box isn't about champ or team identification--its about finding that champs level

The only thing that really bugs me about the new health bars is the level box, which I think is a combination of alignment and color (in addition to what the comment above was mentioning). On live, the box has a dark outline, but the interior is only a shade darker than the rest of the bar. In contrast, the v3 level box has a super dark interior color, and it creates a lot of contrast with the rest of the health bar that wasn't there before, but honestly doesn't seem to improve readability that much. This is combined with the fact that on live, the top of the level box is flush with the top of the health bar, whereas in v3, the health bar is centered in the side of the level box. 

All of these changes make the v3 healthbars feel more to me like a level box stuck onto a health bar, and just a fair bit less integrated, smooth, and polished than those on live. Perhaps I'm nitpicking a little, but this is an element of the game players have to stare at a lot, and I want to make sure you guys have the feedback you need to nail it :)

I would prefer it stay the way it is. There is nothing wrong with self on left, everyone else on right. Its what we know, its what we love.

Gimme an example.

Volibear passive (don't think there's any other champ with that kind of ability), and the more general case with hexdrinker/maw and sterak's.
If you mean an in-game example, voli with his low health baits is the classic one, then we have burst mages that have to play around the hex/maw and there's the sterak's case, but with the shortest CD out of them all, you pretty much expect them to have it by the next fight (annoying when you lane against someone tho, as you are not sure if its up again).

On a side note, these effects have a pretty inconsistent way to show in the buff bar if they are up or already used: maw/hexdrinker shows only after they were used (same as volibear passive) , the new nullifying orb rune shows only when is available and sterak's is the weirder one, as it shows is buff icon only after taking damage while the passive is available.

Have you considered having a different color (purple?) for healthbars of neutral monsters, to distinguish them from things that are enemy-team aligned? It's particularly strange in spectator view that all the neutral monsters look like they're aligned with red team.
Hadn't really considered it, but you're right that there's a host of issues related to one team being red on spectator.

I know that when I was a beginner I found it confusing even in-game, because the red healthbars made me think an actual enemy was around. Any chance that you might give neutral monsters a neutral healthbar color while you're working on healthbars?

(related rant - It's also terribly confusing that there's a blue team red buff and a red team blue buff, and that when a commentator says "red side" they might mean "the side that red team is on" or "the side that [insert team here]'s red buff is on". The dream - at least for spectating eSports - would be if each team could actually get their own color, so (for example) UoL vs Splyce would have nexuses (nexes?), towers, minions, healthbars etc in pink and yellow rather than red and blue.)

So something I'd specifically like to see regarding health bars is status changing color effects directly affecting a champions ability to be damaged. 

Damage reductions, damage amplifiers, invincibility, resurrection, Stasis. 

Tryn and Kayle are probably the biggest culprits of this especially in a team fight. Having their health bar turn gold lined in red might be a way to clarify the invincibility. 

But the ~problem goes deeper. There are champions who when activating an ability gain massive damage reduction, such as Galio and Alister. 
So the questions I come to is:
-Should this be telegraphed
-if telegraphed, will this hurt the ability of those champions
-should a champions ability to be viable be conditional on if damage reduction is telegraphed or not? 


Just some food for thought.
